newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia sells 2.12 pct of Slavneft at auction.
newsitem.headline: Russia sells 2.12 pct of Slavneft at auction.

text.p: Russia has sold 2.12 percent of Slavneft oil company at a price of 12,121 roubles per share on a starting price of 5,000 roubles per share at a specialised auction, the Federal Securities Corporation said on Friday.
Slavneft's main production unit is Megionneftegaz.
The Corporation also said in a statement that Slavneft shares had split 40 to one after the auction. The face value of each share is now one rouble.
A total of 12 legal entities and 37 private individuals bought the Slavneft shares. No names of buyers were revealed.
Megionneftegaz shares are actively traded on the Russian shares market. The stock closed at $5.20 on Thursday on the Russian Trading System.
